pullRequest.body:
This makes `StarOrderedRing` take `StarRing` as a parameter instead of extending it, and as a result moves the typeclass to `Prop`. It was already a mixin with respect to the order and algebraic structure. There are two primary motivations:

1. This makes it possible to directly assume that `C(α, R)` is a `StarOrderedRing` with `[StarOrderedRing C(α, R)]`, as currently there is no typeclass on `R` which would naturally guarantee this property. This is relevant as we want this type class on continuous functions for the continuous functional calculus.
2. We will eventually want a `StarOrderedRing` instance on `C(α, A)` where `A` is a complex (or even real) C⋆-algebra, and making this a mixin avoids loops with `StarRing`.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body:
> currently there is no typeclass on `R` which would naturally guarantee this property.

Is there a natural typeclass that _could_ exist here?

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/42fd3b8e-8007-4575-8bea-f04848537d49) for commit 57ab5cca68fddb8ba98d385f15ab67ccd5d1e566.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/8ce6c097-63bb-401b-a6e4-e2c98a58261c/to/42fd3b8e-8007-4575-8bea-f04848537d49) against commit 8667e5da7a8163884a409b24fbffe8b1ccb8c8f4.

> > currently there is no typeclass on `R` which would naturally guarantee this property.
> 
> Is there a natural typeclass that _could_ exist here?

@eric-wieser I couldn't come up with one. A possible one is to assume that there exists a `sqrt : R → R`, with `ContinuousOn sqrt {x : R | 0 ≤ x}` and `∀ x, 0 ≤ x → star (sqrt x) * sqrt x`, but (a) that's basically, but not quite, just assuming `StarOrderedRing C(α, R)`, and (b) in order to actually make it work, you need `R` to be a ring, as opposed to a semiring, so it doesn't apply to `C(α, ℝ≥0)`.

Your changes to the PR description look fine.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8572500510/job/23495195722)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8572500510/job/23495195044)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8572500510/job/23495195279)

I've tweaked your description to be more precise, please check it's still accurate!

1 feels slightly strange to me, but maybe there genuinely is no interesting typeclass on `R`. 2 feels a little inflexible, but no more so than our existing infrastructure for swapping between real and complex.

I've tweaked your description to be more precise, please check it's still accurate!

1 feels slightly strange to me, but maybe there genuinely is no interesting typeclass on `R`. 2 feels a little inflexible, but no more so than our existing infrastructure for swapping between real and complex.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: make `StarOrderedRing` a mixin
